security: The documents discuss internal CIA procedures and interactions with external bodies such as the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) and the LBJ Library. Releasing internal correspondence about document retrieval, compliance efforts, and classification processes could reveal internal workflows and potentially expose sensitive information management practices. For example, the mention of limiting access to sensitive material to specific individuals (Jeremy Gunn, David Marwell) within the ARRB highlights concerns about information control. Exposing these procedures could compromise the agency's ability to manage sensitive information effectively.
summary: This collection of memoranda and letters primarily concerns the Assassination Records Review Board's (ARRB) requests for CIA documents related to the JFK assassination, including efforts to locate, review, and declassify relevant materials, as well as interactions with the Lyndon Baines Johnson (LBJ) Library.
summary_one_paragraph: This document contains correspondence, memoranda, and lists detailing the Assassination Records Review Board's (ARRB) requests for JFK assassination-related documents from the CIA and the CIA's efforts to comply. It includes requests for specific publications, analytical materials, and compliance procedures, along with internal CIA communications regarding document searches, reviews, and interactions with the LBJ Library for declassification of materials. The collection also touches upon document retrieval methods, outstanding LBJ Library documents, and discussions on prioritizing and providing access to sensitive materials.
title: Assassination Records Review Board Request for Additional Information and Records No. CIA-9 (Publications and analytical materials)
origin_agency: Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) and CIA
recipient: John Pereira, John M. Deutch, Dick Flynn, Jim Hanrahan, John Loverro, Barry Harrelson, Richard J. Flynn
sender: David G. Marwell, Barry Harrelson, John Loverro, Richard J. Flynn, Michelle
